intro: Limonium stephanii, commonly known as sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in saline and well-drained soils, often found in dunes and rocky shores. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Limonium stephanii is valued for its ornamental beauty and its ability to stabilize coastal soils.
